body:
Title: A Fancy Place with a View
Pairing:  Ochamomo
Rating: T
Word Count: 1,998
Read on Ao3
Summary:  

Ochako is nervous to meetup at a fancy restaurant with Momo for their first date.

Full fic under the cut! Thanks to @amaisenshi for helping me with this one!

Ochako felt her knees tremble, standing outside of the tall building. She glanced down at her cell phone, and brushed her thumb over the screen. Supposedly, the restaurant was on the top floor. One of those fancy places with a view…

She tugged on the bottom of her pink, knee-length dress, wondering if it was good enough. It was Momo, so really, she should’ve expected nothing less from the place they would share their first date.

First date.

Ochako couldn’t help the way her stomach flip flopped and her teeth scraped over her lip. Knowing Momo, she probably was already here too. Ochako wasn’t late, but her girlfriend was always early.

Girlfriend.

The word felt a little foreign to her. Momo was indeed her girlfriend. She really was that lucky. Ochako pursed her lips, rocking back and forth on her heels. It was now or never, and she really didn’t want to keep Momo waiting.

She stepped inside the building, the ornate entryway intimidating her even more. A large chandelier hung from the ceiling, the crystals glistening and shimmering in the soft lighting. She really hoped there were some lower priced items on the menu so she could actually afford to eat at this restaurant.

Her heels clacked against the ground, the ribbons on the back of her shoes gently bouncing on her ankles as she made her way over to the elevator. What if there were things on the menu Ochako didn’t even know. Maybe it would be one of those places with dishes she couldn’t pronounce. That would be… embarrassing.

Momo was a woman of class, and Ochako wanted to prove she could be tool. These sort of things were important to Momo and therefore, Ochako wanted to do her best for the dark haired girl.

At the very least, she could fake it until she made it.

“Going up, miss?” The elevator attendant smiled at her and she nodded. At least she didn’t look so out of place going up there.

“Yes! Thank you!” she exclaimed, her voice higher pitched and squeakier than she wanted it to be. She bowed quickly, and touched at the pink bow in her hair, hoping it stayed in place.

Taking a deep breath, she stepped onto the elevator, the attendant smiling. “Is this your first time at the Skyview?” the man asked.

“Uh! Uhm! Yes!” she yelled and quickly glanced down. “W-Was it obvious?”

“You seem a little nervous,” the man nodded.

“Mmm… It is my first time but I’m sure it’ll be fine,” she said, shaking her head. So much for being able to handle herself well.

“Meeting someone special?” The man asked, chuckling softly.

“Uhm… yeah,” she sighed, remembering this was her and Momo’s first date.

It was difficult not to like Momo. The girl was tall and beautiful, with her perfect breasts and long dark hair; Ochako often found it difficult not to stare. But it wasn’t just how attractive the girl was… she was also intelligent and kind, and she always wanted to help out her friends.

Of course Ochako had fallen for her.

The last thing she expected was for Momo to like her back. Ochako had blurted out her thoughts while they were studying one day.

“I wish we could go on a real date!”

Momo had blinked, confusion written over her features. “A real date?”

“A-Ah! Uhm… Y-You know… I -I mean you don’t have to! I’m sure so many boys have asked you out!” Ochako stammered, flailing her arms towards Momo.

“Not exactly… no…” Momo said, but she gently placed her hand over Ochako’s. “If you want to accompany me on a date, I would be honored.”

Honored?

At the time, Ochako had thought Momo was kidding. She playfully nudged her friend, assuming the girl couldn’t actually have feelings for her, but Momo had just stared, tilting her head while she expectantly awaited Ochako’s reply.

“O-Oh! Y-You meant it?!”

“O-Of course I-I did! Didn’t you!?” Momo looked flustered suddenly, as if she had made a mistake.

“N-No! I-I mean yes! I did mean it! I mean … I uhm… would love to go on a date with you.”

So, here she was, stepping off of an elevator for their first date.

Walking into the lobby of the restaurant, she swallowed as she approached the hostess.

“Good evening, ma'am! Do you have a reservation?”

“O-Oh uhm, I’m Uraraka Ochako, I’m meeting Yaoyorozu Momo here,” she said quickly.

“Ah! Yes! Yaoyorozu-san is already here. I’ll take you to her,” the woman said, bowing.

Leading her over to the table, Ochako felt her heart skip a beat when she saw Momo sitting at the table by herself. Her black hair was down, cascading down her back against the chair. Her red dress dipped down into her cleavage and it hugged the curve of her hips so well, Ochako could tell it was a perfect fit, even with the other girl sitting down. She also had on long silver earrings which glistened in the soft lighting of the restaurant.

She smiled when she saw Ochako round the corner, her lips curling into a large smile. She stood up, and immediately approached the girl when she neared the table. “Ochako-chan!” she giggled and leaned forward to peck a kiss on her cheek. “You made it!”

“Sorry, I’m a little late,” she admitted, taking a seat. She reluctantly let go of Momo’s hand, loving how soft her skin was. Everything about Momo was so unfair.

“Oh no! You’re right on time! I was just… early. Y-You know… I was a little anxious so I rushed here when I really didn’t have to,” she admitted.

“You were anxious?” Ochako glanced around the restaurant. What could Momo possibly be anxious about; she was in her element!

Momo sighed. “I’ve never done something like this before and you’re my close friend… I didn’t want to ruin anything. I-I never thought you would actually want to go on a date.”

“I-I didn’t think you would want to!” she admitted, a laugh slipping from her lips. It was silly, them both being nervous about the same thing.

“No, of course I do! Ochako you’re so cute and positive and talented and I…” Momo trailed off, suddenly feeling awkward. The girl ran her finger over the tablecloth covering the edge of the table.

“What?” Ochako asked.

“I-I really like you,” she said.

Ochako’s cheeks grew even more pink. “I really like you too,” she said, and her lips couldn’t stop smiling.

Picking up a menu however, her face immediately fell. As expected, the prices were absolutely insane. One small piece of meat was a price she couldn’t even stomach to think about.

“This place has amazing food, so no matter what you choose, you can’t go wrong,” Momo said, watching her while Ochako struggled to find something in her budget. Maybe a small loaf of bread would qualify as dinner?

“Y-Yeah!” Ochako stammered. She had been afraid of this! She probably should’ve made Momo aware of her budget beforehand-

“Ochako-chan, is everything okay?” she asked.

Ochako swallowed, she didn’t want to offend Momo, but… “Well…” Ochako trailed off, swallowing. “It’s… the prices. They’re a little expensive so I’m trying to find something in my budget-”

“Ochako-chan, of course this dinner is my treat,” Momo said, reaching to take Ochako’s hand, but the other girl quickly pulled away.

“I-I can’t let you do that! This is so expensive!”

“But Ochako-chan,” Momo whispered, stroking her thumb over the back of her palm. “Since I chose this place, I figured it would be my treat. You can choose the next one.”

Ochako pursed her lips. “It… won’t be fancy like this.”

“Ochako-chan,” Momo spoke her name so lighty, as though it danced across her lips with such ease. “I don’t mind, I promise. Part of the fun is… coming here with you and seeing you dressed up! But… no matter where we go, it’s going to be fun! P-Plus… you’re my girlfriend now, so… so I… I want to treat you sometimes.”

Momo’s cheeks were bright red, almost as red as her dress, and she kept brushing her thumb back and forth over the table cloth. Ochako couldn’t help but start to laugh. They were both acting so nervous, and for what? They were clearly happy to be there, and before this they were friends! Was this really any different?

“I-I’m sorry if I offended you-”

“No! Momo-chan, no!” Ochako said, flailing her hands in front of her. “It’s… just funny we’re so worried about nothing! We want to spend time with each other and… you’re right… it doesn’t matter where. I promise though… I will treat you next time,” she nodded and gently placed the menu down. “I also… uhm… might need help pronouncing some of these dishes.”

Both girls began to laugh, the nervous energy slowly dissipating.

Momo went through the menu with Ochako, the two girls picking out what they wanted to eat. As nervous as she had been, the realization that not much had changed did wonders for Ochako’s nerves, and the dinner continued on as if the awkwardness had never been there.

It really was some of the best food Ochako had ever tasted.

“Mmm,” she hummed, cupping her cheek. “I just want to savor every bite!”

“We’ll have to come again so you can try more dishes,” Momo said, giggling softly.

“But I’ll just want to get this one again,” Ochako whined, the girls laughing together. Secretly, Ochako couldn’t help but feel completely warm, knowing Momo wanted to do this again. It was such a smooth transition, it was hard to not want to spend every evening out with her like this.

Plus, getting to see Momo in a variety of dresses would surely be a bonus.

Ochako tried not to feel guilty when Momo paid the bill, though she did assure the girl she would be getting the next one.

“There’s one more thing I want to show you,” Momo said, pushing out her chair. “There’s an observation deck over here, and if you eat at the restaurant you can enjoy the view.”

Ochako blinked, wrapping her hand around Momo’s as they walked towards the entrance of the observation deck.

Momo wrapped her small sweater around herself, the cool breeze making their dresses flap against the wind. Ochako immediately rushed to the railing, her brown hair brushing against her cheek. The view of the city was breathtaking; the lights looked like stars, exciting and twinkling against the tall buildings. The cars moved slowly, looking like tiny toys she could reach down and pluck out of traffic.

“Momo-chan!” Ochako smiled, “this is so cool!”

“I know! I thought you would enjoy it!” Momo said, standing next to her.

“Thank you,” Ochako whispered, leaning her head against Momo’s arm, lacing their fingers together.

“For what?” Momo asked softly. “I should be thanking you.”

“Me!? What for?!” Ochako exclaimed, pulling back to look at the taller girl. “You brought me here, so I was thanking you!”

“Well… I wanted to thank you for going on this date with me,” Momo said quietly.

“Momo-chan,” Ochako smiled, squeezing her hand. “I wanted to.” Stepping forward, she stood on her toes, brushing her lips against Momo’s. They were soft and tasted like strawberries, and Ochako was dying to deepen the kiss, but she didn’t want to overwhelm her, especially not in such a fancy public place. Most people didn’t appreciate excessive PDA.

“O-Ochako-chan,” Momo breathed out, her cheeks flushed.

“I want to go on more dates… if you want to,” Ochako said, swinging their hands back and forth gently.

“I would love that!” Momo smiled.

“Yay!” Ochako cheered, holding up their hands. “Me too!”

The two girls laughed, turning back to enjoy the view. Ochako couldn’t imagine being with anyone else, and she had a feeling this wouldn’t be the last time they shared this view together. And Ochako wouldn’t have had it any other way.

Momo had blinked, confusion written over her features. “A real date?”

“A-Ah! Uhm… Y-You know… I -I mean you don’t have to! I’m sure so many boys have asked you out!” Ochako stammered, flailing her arms towards Momo.

“Not exactly… no…” Momo said, but she gently placed her hand over Ochako’s. “If you want to accompany me on a date, I would be honored.”

Honored?

At the time, Ochako had thought Momo was kidding. She playfully nudged her friend, assuming the girl couldn’t actually have feelings for her, but Momo had just stared, tilting her head while she expectantly awaited Ochako’s reply.

“O-Oh! Y-You meant it?!”

“O-Of course I-I did! Didn’t you!?” Momo looked flustered suddenly, as if she had made a mistake.

“N-No! I-I mean yes! I did mean it! I mean … I uhm… would love to go on a date with you.”

So, here she was, stepping off of an elevator for their first date.

Walking into the lobby of the restaurant, she swallowed as she approached the hostess.

“Good evening, ma'am! Do you have a reservation?”

“O-Oh uhm, I’m Uraraka Ochako, I’m meeting Yaoyorozu Momo here,” she said quickly.

“Ah! Yes! Yaoyorozu-san is already here. I’ll take you to her,” the woman said, bowing.

Leading her over to the table, Ochako felt her heart skip a beat when she saw Momo sitting at the table by herself. Her black hair was down, cascading down her back against the chair. Her red dress dipped down into her cleavage and it hugged the curve of her hips so well, Ochako could tell it was a perfect fit, even with the other girl sitting down. She also had on long silver earrings which glistened in the soft lighting of the restaurant.

She smiled when she saw Ochako round the corner, her lips curling into a large smile. She stood up, and immediately approached the girl when she neared the table. “Ochako-chan!” she giggled and leaned forward to peck a kiss on her cheek. “You made it!”

“Sorry, I’m a little late,” she admitted, taking a seat. She reluctantly let go of Momo’s hand, loving how soft her skin was. Everything about Momo was so unfair.

“Oh no! You’re right on time! I was just… early. Y-You know… I was a little anxious so I rushed here when I really didn’t have to,” she admitted.

“You were anxious?” Ochako glanced around the restaurant. What could Momo possibly be anxious about; she was in her element!

Momo sighed. “I’ve never done something like this before and you’re my close friend… I didn’t want to ruin anything. I-I never thought you would actually want to go on a date.”

“I-I didn’t think you would want to!” she admitted, a laugh slipping from her lips. It was silly, them both being nervous about the same thing.

“No, of course I do! Ochako you’re so cute and positive and talented and I…” Momo trailed off, suddenly feeling awkward. The girl ran her finger over the tablecloth covering the edge of the table.

“What?” Ochako asked.

“I-I really like you,” she said.

Ochako’s cheeks grew even more pink. “I really like you too,” she said, and her lips couldn’t stop smiling.

Picking up a menu however, her face immediately fell. As expected, the prices were absolutely insane. One small piece of meat was a price she couldn’t even stomach to think about.

“This place has amazing food, so no matter what you choose, you can’t go wrong,” Momo said, watching her while Ochako struggled to find something in her budget. Maybe a small loaf of bread would qualify as dinner?

“Y-Yeah!” Ochako stammered. She had been afraid of this! She probably should’ve made Momo aware of her budget beforehand-

“Ochako-chan, is everything okay?” she asked.

Ochako swallowed, she didn’t want to offend Momo, but… “Well…” Ochako trailed off, swallowing. “It’s… the prices. They’re a little expensive so I’m trying to find something in my budget-”

“Ochako-chan, of course this dinner is my treat,” Momo said, reaching to take Ochako’s hand, but the other girl quickly pulled away.

“I-I can’t let you do that! This is so expensive!”

“But Ochako-chan,” Momo whispered, stroking her thumb over the back of her palm. “Since I chose this place, I figured it would be my treat. You can choose the next one.”

Ochako pursed her lips. “It… won’t be fancy like this.”

“Ochako-chan,” Momo spoke her name so lighty, as though it danced across her lips with such ease. “I don’t mind, I promise. Part of the fun is… coming here with you and seeing you dressed up! But… no matter where we go, it’s going to be fun! P-Plus… you’re my girlfriend now, so… so I… I want to treat you sometimes.”

Momo’s cheeks were bright red, almost as red as her dress, and she kept brushing her thumb back and forth over the table cloth. Ochako couldn’t help but start to laugh. They were both acting so nervous, and for what? They were clearly happy to be there, and before this they were friends! Was this really any different?

“I-I’m sorry if I offended you-”

“No! Momo-chan, no!” Ochako said, flailing her hands in front of her. “It’s… just funny we’re so worried about nothing! We want to spend time with each other and… you’re right… it doesn’t matter where. I promise though… I will treat you next time,” she nodded and gently placed the menu down. “I also… uhm… might need help pronouncing some of these dishes.”

Both girls began to laugh, the nervous energy slowly dissipating.

Momo went through the menu with Ochako, the two girls picking out what they wanted to eat. As nervous as she had been, the realization that not much had changed did wonders for Ochako’s nerves, and the dinner continued on as if the awkwardness had never been there.

It really was some of the best food Ochako had ever tasted.

“Mmm,” she hummed, cupping her cheek. “I just want to savor every bite!”

“We’ll have to come again so you can try more dishes,” Momo said, giggling softly.

“But I’ll just want to get this one again,” Ochako whined, the girls laughing together. Secretly, Ochako couldn’t help but feel completely warm, knowing Momo wanted to do this again. It was such a smooth transition, it was hard to not want to spend every evening out with her like this.

Plus, getting to see Momo in a variety of dresses would surely be a bonus.

Ochako tried not to feel guilty when Momo paid the bill, though she did assure the girl she would be getting the next one.

“There’s one more thing I want to show you,” Momo said, pushing out her chair. “There’s an observation deck over here, and if you eat at the restaurant you can enjoy the view.”

Ochako blinked, wrapping her hand around Momo’s as they walked towards the entrance of the observation deck.

Momo wrapped her small sweater around herself, the cool breeze making their dresses flap against the wind. Ochako immediately rushed to the railing, her brown hair brushing against her cheek. The view of the city was breathtaking; the lights looked like stars, exciting and twinkling against the tall buildings. The cars moved slowly, looking like tiny toys she could reach down and pluck out of traffic.

“Momo-chan!” Ochako smiled, “this is so cool!”

“I know! I thought you would enjoy it!” Momo said, standing next to her.

“Thank you,” Ochako whispered, leaning her head against Momo’s arm, lacing their fingers together.

“For what?” Momo asked softly. “I should be thanking you.”

“Me!? What for?!” Ochako exclaimed, pulling back to look at the taller girl. “You brought me here, so I was thanking you!”

“Well… I wanted to thank you for going on this date with me,” Momo said quietly.

“Momo-chan,” Ochako smiled, squeezing her hand. “I wanted to.” Stepping forward, she stood on her toes, brushing her lips against Momo’s. They were soft and tasted like strawberries, and Ochako was dying to deepen the kiss, but she didn’t want to overwhelm her, especially not in such a fancy public place. Most people didn’t appreciate excessive PDA.

“O-Ochako-chan,” Momo breathed out, her cheeks flushed.

“I want to go on more dates… if you want to,” Ochako said, swinging their hands back and forth gently.

“I would love that!” Momo smiled.

“Yay!” Ochako cheered, holding up their hands. “Me too!”

The two girls laughed, turning back to enjoy the view. Ochako couldn’t imagine being with anyone else, and she had a feeling this wouldn’t be the last time they shared this view together. And Ochako wouldn’t have had it any other way.

title: Hallelujah
description:
by The_Plot_Thickens

The Imperial Scholars’ Program is a government-run organization that took in only the highest ranked students. It’s known for being very selective. Kids study for years to get in, and very few still make it. At its head is Director Mamoru Arai, the Emperor’s right hand man. And at Director Mamoru’s side? An army of students willing to die to protect Japan, one more than the rest.
—————————————————–
“We’re at war and when you are at war, you will do anything to stop it.”
The hero scowled. “But we’re not at war. It’s peaceful.”
The director smiled. “I think you’re mistaking ‘peaceful’ for 'quiet’. Eraserhead, even the quietest wars need soldiers. These just happen to be mine.”
As his student stepped out, Aizawa’s eyes widened. His cup hits the ground along with his heart.
No…..

trail.content:
by The_Plot_Thickens

The Imperial Scholars’ Program is a government-run organization that took in only the highest ranked students. It’s known for being very selective. Kids study for years to get in, and very few still make it. At its head is Director Mamoru Arai, the Emperor’s right hand man. And at Director Mamoru’s side? An army of students willing to die to protect Japan, one more than the rest.
—————————————————–
“We’re at war and when you are at war, you will do anything to stop it.”
The hero scowled. “But we’re not at war. It’s peaceful.”
The director smiled. “I think you’re mistaking ‘peaceful’ for 'quiet’. Eraserhead, even the quietest wars need soldiers. These just happen to be mine.”
As his student stepped out, Aizawa’s eyes widened. His cup hits the ground along with his heart.
No…..

blog.name: sara-honey-the-social-inept
blog.title: Just Sara
blog.description:
I write then sometimes I draw but most of the time I don't know wtf I'm doing so... it's a mess. welcome anyway.
❤🔥TodoBaku/BakuTodo 🔥❤
Also with a severe Momo obsession.

body:
TodoBaku meeting parents alone

Bakugou’s household

*Mitsuki opening the door for an awkward Todoroki Shouto*

Mitsuki: hey Todoroki right? Oh you are in a designer suit!

*Todoroki tensing up*

Tdrk: is that… Bad?

Mitsuki: no, I just didn’t expect it. (So much for those being misguided in fashion comments Katsuki.) We didn’t get poshed up.

Tdrk: neither did I.

(Okay, Maybe that brat was right on some levels!)

Mitsuk: well, here we are. Come on in.

*Todoroki not stepping in*

Tdrk: I bought wine.

*offering the fancy liquor*

Mitsuki: that’s very kind of you. Now…

Tdrk: and flowers.

*holding a massive bouquet of expensive rare flowers*

Mitsuki: oh you didn’t need to…

*accepting the gift trying not to be shocked*

Tdrk: And chocolates.

*pulling a basket full of any kind of chocolates*

Mitsuki: wow…

Tdrk: wasn’t sure which to choose so I got them all.

(Mitsuki had the suspension that the explanation given for the chocolate basket can be applied to all of the gift set.)

Mitsuki with an understanding smile: bless. Come in.

*Todoroki pulling out five different car keys from his pocket*

Tdrk: actually…

_______________________________

Meanwhile at the Todoroki household:

*Bakugou marching in*

Bkg: Oi yo flammable trash bin. Shouto got a new daddy now… Fight me.

title: A Caricature of Destiny
description:
by NoteInABottle

“Bite me,” Deku said, and his scent filled with pain as if he had broken down crying, just like he used to as a child, too overwhelmed by harsh reality.

Premise:
-Bakugou Katsuki is an Alpha, and Midoriya Izuku is an Omega
-An Omega goes into heat periodically, releasing pheromones that other Alphas can sense. These heats are debilitating and often -disqualify an Omega from being a productive member of normal society.
-Alphas and Omegas can form a lifelong “pair” bond when the alpha bites the omega’s neck. This way, the Omega’s heats only affects their paired Alpha.
-Mating during a heat can mess with an Omega’s hormones, preventing them from growing muscles or improving their quirk.

{Based on Kanraku Destiny}

by NoteInABottle

“Bite me,” Deku said, and his scent filled with pain as if he had broken down crying, just like he used to as a child, too overwhelmed by harsh reality.

Premise:
-Bakugou Katsuki is an Alpha, and Midoriya Izuku is an Omega
-An Omega goes into heat periodically, releasing pheromones that other Alphas can sense. These heats are debilitating and often -disqualify an Omega from being a productive member of normal society.
-Alphas and Omegas can form a lifelong “pair” bond when the alpha bites the omega’s neck. This way, the Omega’s heats only affects their paired Alpha.
-Mating during a heat can mess with an Omega’s hormones, preventing them from growing muscles or improving their quirk.

{Based on Kanraku Destiny}

title: Over Powered Deku
body: Can we just like, talk for a minute about how freaking overpowered Deku would be if he somehow got Yaoyorozu’s quirk? Because he is so ridiculously smart and crafty and just… The way he dissects quirks in his notebook could so easily transfer to everyday things that he could actually get his hands on that it’s almost frightening to think about.
